comments.body:
It could still be exploited becasue wood is infinite and you can literally find a village and explode it and you’ll get more wood than you know what to do with.
to make it more fair I suggest that this would only work with naturally spawning bookshelves and not ones crafted by the player

But at that point you are crafting something, in order to make the book shelf you need a leather farm, a sugar cane farm, and a wood farm.
They don't drop an equal amount of books anyway.

And plus if you are mining it with silk touch then you are just going to get a bookshelf.
Who knew ink could have a use like this? You have given me an idea to make a mod that has this brilliant idea!
Thank you 397302839611 ! I'm glad to hear that I've inspired you, and when it's finished I'd love to check it out and see what it's about!
Won't this require us to be able to make noodles first? And there's a lot of dishes that could be made with noodles then, ones a bit more orthodox.
Gourmet dishes are weird, I dont want them in minecraft. I also don't want bird's nest stew in minecraft. That is a real soup btw
Cool idea, but those stats are too OP.
Maybe It Gives You Blindness As Well?
Maybe It Gives You Blindness As Well?

394038731272 Trust me, I'd make noodles neat if somebody didn't already suggest it. Cause of that I just thought of a very unique but interesting noodle dish that I'd love to see in the game.

394741626112 Some gourmet dishes are weird but this is literally noodles with black color added by slight bits of natural colorings. You could fight all day over the technicalities but with all due respect that doesn't compare to your favorite meal.

387747146711 That's actually a really good point that I can agree with you on.

395500816791 Do you even know how food is cooked? Like barely any squid ink is actually added in real life because chefs know it's not good for too much
I had the idea that the crafting recept can be a scissor with two diamonds
This glass cutter should instantly break glass with max efficiency enchantment. Currently with a max pick axe it takes a long time to mine glass.
Love the idea but it should be able to be lit by other explosions. (ex: ghast, tnt, fire charge or firework.)
if you want a bed explosion just use a respawn anchor in the overworld.
dorkmuffin1 beds aren't stack-able and don't explode in a chain. they also don't have a fuse.

I'm especially for this because of the fact that if we wanna start in the Nether, we don't really have a way of obtaining tnt otherwise. And it doesn't just need to be blaze powder, since Ghasts also drop gunpowder.
Thats a wonderfull Idea
Already possible with commands, but good idea
This would be great for a structures. Nice idea!

What is the difference from having a sword with Flame IV then? Also, two lava buckets and a stick could be had in the first hour of a new world. There needs to be some deficit to balance this. I'd prefer seeing completely new weapons instead of "fire", "ice", etc sword. Hammers, two handed axes, these would add more.

That sword should be found in chests of Nether Fortresses and the player should not be able to craft it. As your idea says, The sword would be created with 2 lava buckets and one stick. Isn't that to simple for a sword that does 9 damage and flame IV? This is a good idea but you could do the sword harder to craft or to find.
I like this idea. I think these large fungi would make great additions for my idea of a Icy Nether Biome.
Another ore that can be utilized through the smithing table!
Isn't this basically netherite?
It would be cool if that was added to the leather also giving it special abilities, in real life chrome is used to remove the fur from the leather. Maybe that function could be added
So it's like a gravity block that floats in water
Pumice, Pumice is a rock that floats  in water due to air pockets
It's kinda like sand with soul sand.
It's kinda like sand with soul sand.
I like the pumice stone idea :). What if it can be placed on water.
You can literally put a yellow glass block on top.
Bread is bad for birds. Same reason cookies will kill parrots.

I suggest not since Bread can be dangerous for birds and has a fair potential to kill them. Since minecraft likes to educate people I do not think giving them the idea to poison birds is a good suggestion.
Really, really, really good idea!
Great idea i would love to see this in the nether update! Though i think it should spread wither not poison. And drop glowstone when it explodes
I was thinking wither too, but I think it would be too overpowered for a block that can be dropped/launched, even if the duration was shortened. Also poison gives honey a use in the Nether.
Too much like terraria also no reason elaborating would be nice
Yes of course, thanks fors your comment;however I think having hearts in addiction tu the usual 10 without eating golden apples can be cool
The terraria subreddit already acts as if minecraft rips off terraria. DOn't five them more materials to make memes about.
I totally support this. I actually made a mod of this, exactly. If Mojang wants to dm I can literally give them the textures and model.
To reduce the consumption of mouse buttons?
Just use a cobblestone generator
YES I NEED THIS
I like this idea!
It's not just those 3 who use magic. There is also the old guardian, the wither and wither skeleton, the stray skeleton and finally the zombie husk
maybe one block of obsidian and 8 ghast tears per 1 block. it would also mean that you would have to kill at least 48 ghasts before making a respawn anchor.
Maybe instead of 8 ghast tears surround 2 ghast tears and a glowing ink sac with 6 obsidian, or 2 glowing ink sacs and 1 ghast tear.
Yes but only blocks underneath them!
This sounds like a recipe for disaster, not going to lie
Sounds too overpowered and doesn't make much sense. Have you ever thrown a snowball at a window the window remains undamaged.
add it to all editions, not just bedrock. If it is not to snowballs, then add it to arrows and fireworks, or all three!!!
the idea is fun. The benefits are limited but why not?

Diamonds for sure should be generated in the Nether, considering real life diamonds are generated by pressure and heat. It makes sense that diamonds could be found in the Nether. I don't really agree that anything else should be naturally generated in the Nether, however. So I can't upvote this, because I don't agree with it as it's worded.

I'm very happy that Gold Ore now spawns in the Nether, but personally I think that's the only one from the Overworld that should.

While you may be right Krythic4031 in it potentially making sense for Diamonds to spawn in the Nether, I still don't think they should because that would take away from the Overworld having its own valuable material.

The only reason I think it makes sense for the Nether to have Gold is because it's so prevalent there with Piglins / Zombifies Piglins. Any other natural Ores and other valuables in the Nether should be unique to the Nether, in my opinion.
Can’t tell you how long I’ve wanted more cake
Can’t tell you how long I’ve wanted more cake
Please don't judged my spelling grammar or punctuation I usually write/type better but I'm only in fifth grade
That is a good idea, but ability activators should cost emeralds or something, and then that hero head has the ability permanently.

I think it would be better if you could just put the nautilus shells directly into the furnace to create one nautilus ingot. Additionally it would be interesting if you could breath underwater with a full nautilus armor set.
